current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To limit the availability of tax credits and reductions
		  in cost-sharing under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to
		  individuals who receive health insurance coverage pursuant to the provisions of
		  a Taft-Hartley plan.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Limitation on
			 subsidies for individuals in Taft-Hartley plans

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and no reductions in cost-sharing
			 shall be permitted under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 36B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any
			 other provision of law, no premium tax credits shall be permitted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to an individual for health insurance
			 coverage provided pursuant to the terms of a collective bargaining agreement
			 involving one or more employers.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1402 of the Patient Protection and Affordable
			 Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1402

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1301(a) of the Patient Protection and Affordable
			 Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1301/ss:a

term.#tail:
shall not
				include health insurance coverage provided pursuant to the terms of a
				collective bargaining agreement involving one or more
				employers.
